body: Thanks to the reviewers. Selva, what I changed is a static function and I also renamed it, so all the callers of this function have been changed. The other calls to getObjectUID are calls to a method.

I am not sure I understand the changes. I don't see any changes to the regression scripts, for example. But I do see a lot of changes to T4 and T2 driver test suites which don't seem to be relevant to the description of this change?

Something must be messed up.  Let me abandon this change and try it again.

```
 Roberta
```

Just looked at part of the code, I hope together with others we will cover it all. Overall it looks very good! Nice nod to Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard with the use of RPN :-)

I booked a skype meeting at 1pm -3pm this Thursday,  if it's not convenient for all of you, please let me know.
https://meet.partner.lync.cn/esgyncom-esgyn/ruoyu.zuo/VST5VC96
sorry, comment above is Shanghai time, for PST, it must be Wednesday 9pm - 11pm, 13th.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Missing license statement per build check in trafodion/docs/css/trafodion-theme.yml
Fixed missing license statement in yaml file. Please rerun build.
please dont merge, will fix version issue soon and add more API for create/alt/remove libraries.
I'm OK with committing this, so long as the truncated character problem in exp_conv.cpp is taken care of in a later check-in.
Looks good to me. Thanks for cleaning this up.

Change looks really good. Thanks. Please consider adding a query to the hive regression test suite so that developers have a clear idea on how to use this feature. Additionally adding something to the wiki will also help.

One more thing, do we need changes explain and showplan? Or maybe they already work OK.
Changes look good, but I am missing a part: What I would have expected is some code that will automatically convert data from the HIVE_FILE_CHARSET to HIVE_DEFAULT_CHARSET, if the two are different.
The title for this change seems to be incorrect; should it be [TRAFODION-1742] Rework, ...
Looks good. Does this bug occur in any of the other HBase tcbs?
+1, this is a tough one to find!

It is possible that it might happen with other tcbs too. It is important that the HTableClient is released from the JNI/ executor side for get, batch get and scan operations. The HTableClient object is released on the java side in case of Put and Delete operations for non-async operations. I will go through the code where getRowOpen, getRowsOpen and scanOpen is being called and fix it in those places too
You say you did not touch the .gitignore file, but your pull request definitely deletes that file. Please put it back.
Looks good !  Tricky one for the eyes indeed especially  when there was no compilation error :-)
Please review the code again. if no more comments, please feel free to merge.

hi, Hans,
I cannot find a good way to do converting automatically. The current implicit converting is triggered only  when source and target data column charset is different. So if we can change HIVE_DEFAULT_CHARSET, which control the source charset, it will do an automatic converting with current code base. But since change that will have side-effect, so that is not supposed to change. Then the current implicit converting code will not be triggered.
In this case, I think ask the admin to explicit do a TRANSLATE make sense.

hi, Suresh,
I would like to add new hive test case later in another pull request.
I don't think we need to add EXPLAIN change for this yet. We will start a bigger project to support GBK totally, EXPLAIN change belong to that task I hope.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/311/
I seem to recall LocaleToUTF8 kind of function getting called at the time of Hive to Trafodion loading. Do we need such conversion in this case.
Changes look really good, very easy to read.  My only concern is the name for the schema and role.

Ming, you said you don't see a good place to add the automatic conversion. Here is what I would suggest: Look at method FileScan::codeGenForHive() in file core/sql/generator/GenRelScan.cpp. This method builds two lists of CAST expressions, one for columns needed in predicates and one for columns needed only in the select lists. It makes CAST nodes by calling HbaseAccess::createAsciiColAndCastExpr(). By the way "ASCII" in this name is not quite correct. This produces an expression cast(NATypeToItem()). The NATypeToItem() represents the Hive column and this is the only place where we would support GBK for now (plus an equivalent place for inserts). If we wanted to translate a value, we would need to assign character set HIVE_FILE_CHARSET to "asciiType" in this method and produce cast(translate(NATypeToItem())) in this method. This would be needed only if a) this is for a Hive table, b) HIVE_FILE_CHARSET is non-empty (i.e. GBK) and not equal to HIVE_DEFAULT_CHARSET. For inserts, you would need to do something similar or disable inserts into GBK tables for now. You could add an optimization to skip the translate for numeric, datetime and interval columns that consist of ASCII characters only, if the translation leaves ASCII unchanged.

About the missing regression test that Suresh mentioned: Not having a test makes it harder to review the code, since the change is not complete. I would prefer a complete change with a test case, or at least a description of what works and what is not yet working.

I was trying to read and follow instructions in document.md. It was a bit hard in raw form, but finally went to github location to see render: https://github.com/gtapper/incubator-trafodion/blob/TRAFODION-1699/docs/src/site/markdown/document.md 
Looks here like one of the tables in the build section is not formatted properly.  At least GH does not render it right.
Also, I was confused by references to MS Word docs, because I could not find any. I think it was oversight that needs to be removed now that all docs are asciidoc.

You refer to putting all these steps together in a makefile, but they are all maven build steps. Why not just put them together in the top-level pom file to build the various docs as sub-projects?  Not an expert in that, but I'd think better to have all maven.
The DCS and REST documents get generated as 2.0.0 per the main trafodion release version, but the other docs all get generated as 1.3.0.  So we have a mis-match.

One other thing.  I did not notice any regression tests related to security.  I assume that you have run tests with security (at least authorization) enabled.  We want to make sure that privileges work and that file permissions are set correctly. If you plan to add any unit tests related to security in SQL regressions, please add them to the new privs2 test suite.

btw - I try to add unit tests for new features at the time I deliver for two reasons - one, if someone else wants to use the new feature, they can look at the tests to understand it better and two, a subsequent delivery will not cause a regression.

Hopefully we can get down to the end game for this change - quite a few comments, but I hope this is justified for a complex change like this one. Overall I really like the way this is done and hope it will work and perform well. Here is a summary of the issues I hope to see resolved:
- Replace tabs in added code with an appropriate number of spaces.
- Remove code that deals with ANDs as the top-level operator.
- Initialize nac in file GenPreCode.cpp, line 11938.
- Research the mystery of why we strip trailing \0 characters from binary constant values (GenPreCode.cpp).
- Remove checks for ITM_REFERENCE (used only in parser/binder). File GenPreCode.cpp.
- Replace str_sprintf with snprintf in new code, based on Dave's comments.

I think you also want the handling of the deep OR from big IN statement that need to be turned off, and don't cause stack memory exception for too deep recursion. I assume that what you mean by str_printf replacement is the fixing of the buffer overrun vulnerability, right? And I'll do it also in the code that I templated mine against without a JIRA if I understood you right...

Eric, the issues with deep ORs, recursion and o(n**2) filter evaluations, I leave those up to you to decide, just wanted to point those out. You could do them now, in a later change or not until someone complains. Yes, the issue with str_sprintf is buffer overruns (not sure whether Dave pointed out any other buffer overruns). Sorry, I'm not sure I understand your last sentence.

The buffer overrun bug was a copy paste from another part of the code that have nothing to do with pred pushdown. What we discussed with Dave, was that instead of fixing the buffer overrun in my code, I would have keep the error in my code, while at the same time create a Jira and work on it to fix the buffer overrun in both my code and the other place where my code was copy pasted from. Instead I thought I understood that you would prefer that I fix the overrun in my code and the other code now, in my next PR, even if the external code has nothing to do with predicate push down, no JIRA overhead...?

Hi Eric,

My view on this is that the rework should fix any "bad" bugs in the _new_
code (:-)).  For those issues in the old code, I am fine with either fixing
in the rework or through JIRA.

Thanks --Qifan
